intro: Iphigenia pallida, commonly known as the pale iphigenia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green to yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a distinctive reddish tinge along the veins. Iphigenia pallida is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
